item.title: Brian add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I sometimes wonder if all pleasures are not substitutes for joy." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Brian add a quote by John Calvin
item.description: "There is no worse screen to block out the Spirit than confidence in our own intelligence." -- John Calvin

item.title: Brian add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "One morning I shot an elephant in my pajamas. How he got in my pajamas I'll never know." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Brian add a quote by Martin Luther
item.description: "I am afraid that the schools will prove the very gates of hell, unless they diligently labor in explaining the Holy Scriptures and engraving them in the heart of the youth." -- Martin Luther

item.title: Brian add a quote by Robert Heinlein
item.description: "Goodness without wisdom always accomplishes evil." -- Robert Heinlein

item.title: Brian add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "When you break the big laws, you do not get liberty; you do not even get anarchy. You get the small laws." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Brian add a quote by C. S. Lewis
item.description: "Of all tyrannies, a tyranny sincerely exercised for the good of its victims may be the most oppressive. It would be better to live under robber barons than under omnipotent moral busybodies. The robber baron's cruelty may sometimes sleep, his cupidity may at some point be satiated; but those who torment us for our own good will torment us without end for they do so with the approval of their own conscience." -- C. S. Lewis

item.title: Brian add a quote by Winston Churchhill
item.description: "The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter." -- Winston Churchhill

item.title: Brian add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Socialism is a philosophy of failure, the creed of ignorance, and the gospel of envy, its inherent virtue is the equal sharing of misery.." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Brian add a quote by John Locke
item.description: "Education begins the gentleman, but reading, good company and reflection must finish him." -- John Locke

item.title: Brian add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The Christian ideal has not been tried and found wanting. It has been found difficult; and left untried." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Brian add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Read Above Your Head--“You may perhaps be brought to acknowledge that it is very well worthwhile to be tormented for two or three years of one’s life, for the sake of being able to read all the rest of it." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Brian add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Read and Re-Read--"Re-reading, we always find a new book." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Brian add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Our Lord finds our desires not too strong, but too weak. We are half-hearted creatures, fooling about with drink and sex and ambition, when infinite joy is offered to us, like an ignorant child who wants to go on making mud pies in the slum because he cannot imagine what is meant by the offer of a holiday at the sea. We are far too easily pleased." -- C.S. Lewis
